natural solution: To start, find a common denominator on the left side. The lowest common multiple of 3 and 4 is 12, so this is the common denominator. Rewrite the equation as: $$\frac{4x}{12}+\frac{3x}{12}=14$$$$\frac{4x+3x}{12}=14$$$$\frac{7x}{12}=14$$Now, multiply both sides of the equation by $\frac{12}{7}$ to solve for $x$: $$\frac{7x}{12}\cdot\frac{12}{7}=14\cdot \frac{12}{7}$$$$x=2\cdot 12=\boxed{24}$$
